answers.answer: Sounds like she needs seen by peds endo, the elevated tsh needs repeated and with an enlarged thyroid her antibodies may now be measureable perhaps before not high enough. She sounds like she has subclinical hypothyroidism, now this alone is not to blame for her weight gain, there are many many other factors, I know you have seen a dietician but seriously look at her diet, take away any sugared drinks including juice, increase her daily exercise to something a little longer and more enjoyable so she can stay compliant. Look at what she is eating at school lunch and if she is having school breakfast and address what the family is eating overall. Is there strong family history of diabetes or obesity in the family. She is around the prepubertal age that she is definitely prone towards insulin resistance. So work with your ped to get a referral and see how they can help you and your daughter.
